intro: Gynandropsis orba, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, which is a common trait among milkweeds. Gynandropsis orba is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
